message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.SY

This paper is about developing a benchmark for physical reasoning and testing learning algorithms on it. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Additionally, the paper focuses on sample-efficient learning algorithms that generalize well, which suggests that it may also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The benchmark involves a 2D physical environment, which suggests that it may also belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The puzzles in the benchmark require reasoning and planning, which suggests that it may also belong to the Robotics (cs.RO) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the development of agents that learn models of physics, which suggests that it may also belong to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category.
